data.title: Cheap and cheerful!
data.text: Came here on recommendation from my hotel, it's a good choice if you are on your own, as I noticed that many of the other customers were too. The staff were friendly and helpful and my meal came to less than $10. I will be returning!

data.title: Great food, big portions and casual atmosphere
data.text:
It's a combo of diner food meets casual family dining....food is fresh, portions are rather generous and the menu is really extensive. My first visit I had the chicken club on sourdough - yum! beautifully grilled chicken, crispy bacon and delicious avocado - simple, fresh food......

Menu goes from breakfast offerings to burgers, sandwiches, pasta and full entrees....absolutely something for every taste!!

Their desserts are ginormous! Probably the biggest piece of lemon meringue pie I have ever seen!!! It was delicious and I took 2/3 of it home and had it with coffee later in the day.

Amazing value, friendly service and with the wide variety of offerings, you can go back many many times and never eat the same thing twice!  They also have a large bar with full service drink menu

data.title: Excellent Breakfast and Desserts!
data.text: Would easily be 5 stars if service was better. Food was delicious but service was slow and staff forgetful. No refill on my coffee? Forgot my OJ? Took a long time to get my bill? Restaurant was not crowded...

data.title: Good breakfast, great service
data.text:
I'm glad the hotel concierge recommended Flames. The service was pleasant and the Omelet was prepared at almost super human speed. 

This restaurant is worth a visit.

data.title: Open Late, Good Food, Reasonably Priced
data.text: Good service combined with a huge variety of food and then open very late was a definite plus. Well located with ample seating. Very gracious staff

data.title: Bad service, below average food
data.text: We went here on a Sunday hoping for a great brunch.  The place was not packed.  We were seated and ordered.  Another couple came in and were seated next to us and they ordered and got their food before us.  We thought maybe the delay would be worth the wait....it wasn't.  The Tex Mex omelet was overcooked and the hash browns were under cooked.  Our waiter was unattentive as he was too busy watching the Olympic soccer game at the bar.  Would NEVER eat here again and would NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Across from MLK library
data.text: a small local chain, with a large menu of time tested favorites, they have unique baked cakes and a full service bar

data.title: A great breakfast place for reasonable prices.
data.text: We stayed at the Westin and were looking for a l coal breakfast place so we could have a decent breakfast for  a reasonable price.  They had great omelettes for around 12 bucks and the breakfast potatoes were excellent.  The cakes were tempting but one piece would easily serve 6 people.

data.title: No.
data.text: It's such a great location downtown and everything on the menu looked so good, but when we actually got it on our table and took a bite it was like someone played a trick  and it was something that kept well in their cooler for months. Chicken this, and chicken that (had the chicken skewers) but it was like plastic and made in about 25 seconds before they brought it to us. Bad sign. Awful disappointment combined with this irritating no-mind fake "hipster" attitude that tried to be a little too "Sunset Grill" without knowing the first thing how to create that atmosphere. If the food was ok we wouldn't care but we ended up feeling like even Denny's would have been a better experience.

data.title: Blegh
data.text: My boyfriend took me to Flames for a Valentine's Day breakfast. I was excited because I had never been before and he said it'd be good. The service was great but the food wasn't impressive. Mine was cold and even though I did request avocado they put WAY too much on each side of my Eggs Benedict. It wasn't even placed on top of the egg, it was underneath the bacon on the bread, who does that? Strange. Anyway, the only reason why I gave an average rating is because our waitress was nice.

data.title: Large menu options
data.text: Joined a large group of friends for dinner before a show.  Our first time here and the place was suggested since it was close see to the evening show. Some ordered breakfast plates, some ordered sandwiches,  a few ordered dinner entrees, and I asked for soup and salad.  Service was fast for our large group but the quality of the food varied from okay to poor.   My husband hated his breakfast dish but did not send it back  as he normally would due to the time constraint.  My soup and salad was simple and tasted fine- nothing extraordinary.  We will probably not return here since we noticed lots of other restaurants to try in the same area near San Jose SU - should we return to this part of the city.

data.title: Good food but service lacking
data.text: I was there for lunch last Saturday with three friends. It was busy but we were seated promptly. Overall, we all liked the food but found the service poor. The wide variety on the menu is good and it allowed us to all to find things we liked. I ordered a turkey burger, no onions, with cole slaw. I got the onions, and it came with fries instead, though the waitress noticed when she brought it and got me cole slaw quickly. Some of us shared the Flames ceviche, a chopped prawn salad with tortilla chips, which was very good. Two of the group shared a pizza which they liked and it was well cooked, but the toppings were a little sparse. When we were seated, there was only one set of tableware, and no one brought any more. When we got our food, we had to ask for the others. We chose Flames because of its proximity to our destination, and I wouldn't hesitate to go back under those circumstances. If I were just looking for a place in downtown San Jose, though, I'd probably try elsewhere.

data.title: Yum x3
data.text: Very extensive menu. They have extensive drinks like  Flame - tinis, Flame-ritas etc... Breakfast all day, lunch and dinner too. Cinnamonmonster French toast(giant cinnamon roll) dipped in a vanilla egg batter, omelets and full dinner. The only downside is that I won't be in town long enough to eat it all.

data.title: Breakfast left a lot to be desired.
data.text:
Breakfast is one of my favorite meals to eat out. Having recently been to Las Vegas, I was tempted by the description of this place as having "Las Vegas style ambience" and the menu items look really delicious; I was also looking forward to the unlimited mimosas. Unfortunately it seemed to me that it had some of the bad aspects of Vegas and none of the good ones. As soon as I walked in I had second thoughts as the place was pretty crowded and loud. There was a waiting list and there were quite a few people waiting outside, some already with mimosas in hand. 
When we got seated, the seats and tables were a bit run-down. The menu's were dog-eared, dirty, stained and even painted on. We ordered the unlimited mimosas which at $11.50 are a great deal. But they are not very good mimosas. They tasted like cheap grocery store orange juice with just a little bit of champagne and they tasted more like carbonated o.j. We had one of their omelettes with the hashbrowns. The food was edible, but not particularly tasty. We also had their caramel-banana French toast. This is one item that we had been looking forward to since the previous day when we read the menu. But this too was a disappointment. It was not very flavorful and rather eggy. Aside from the fresh slices of banana, it was no different than what you get at IHOP. Their lattes are much too expensive for the little cup they serve.
Our server was friendly and checked on us several times when we first started eating. Unfortunately at some point it seemed she must have decided it was time for us to go and stopped. When we were finally able to flag her down we asked her for a last refill of our mimosas. This was around 2:03 and she informed us that she could not because the unlimited mimosas stop at 2:00. I would have expected a good server to stop by and let us know of this and offer a refill. I would also think that considering that it was only a few minutes after 2 and that she had not checked on us for about 15 minutes, that she would have done it without question. The one positive I have for Flames is the price. My breakfast was almost $15 less than I usually pay for a similar breakfast. Needless to say it was not as enjoyable as my usual breakfast.
While this was my first visit to San Jose, I think it makes for a nice quick getaway. I don't think I will eat here again.

data.title: Breakfast was a disappointment
data.text: Trip Advisor reviews suggest that Flames is a good place to visit in the evening.  Unfortunately, on a week day morning it was empty and completely lacking in atmosphere. The food and service were alright but certainly not inspiring.  There must be better alternatives for breakfast in San Jose.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Food at this place is always good and so is their service.  Had spinach salad with shrimps and it was awesome.

data.title: Good service not so good food!
data.text: We came in on a Friday night. The service was really great; however, the food leaves something to be desired. We had high hopes as they had an extensive (good looking menu). I had the clam chowder which tasted like it was out of a bag. My husband had chicken wings which were basically chicken tenders with a little sauce on them. They call themselves a bar, but they had almost no tvs in the entire restaurant. We kinda saw it as a wanna be cheesecake factory. We will not be going back!

data.title: Convenient and open for business at the Airport
data.text:
I ate at the Flames restaurant inside the SJC Airport and found that to be as good as the one downtown San Jose. 

The food was prepared just right, the atmosphere quiet for working while waiting for my flight. 

They could use a couple of new signs to drive business there way on the concourse. Well worth the short walk. 

Very friendly and caring staff. 

Stop by and say hi on your way to your next destination.

data.title: Diner
data.text: True diner food. Food was ok but we were all worried to order seafood or something that may not move fast in a restaurant. Burgers and pizza basics we stuck to. The waiter was visually on crack as he talked a mile a minute in circles and was super jittery. Famous quote: "You like cake, I like cake, everyone likes cake, who doesnt like cake, you have to try the cake, our cake is world famous cake."

data.title: One of my favorites in downtown San Jose
data.text: Great food, great atmosphere, happy hour drinks and appetizers, and splendid location. I don't go here as often as I'd like to.
